name: Professional Digital Outside Micrometer with Carbide Tip 0-1"/0-25mm Measuring Range - 0.00005" / 0.001mm Accuracy with Ratchet Stop and Protective Case - Precision Machinist Workshop Automotive Tool
short_description: PREMIUM 0-1" DIGITAL MICROMETER: Crafted from hardened and ground stainless steel for durability and boasting impressive measuring and accuracy, it's the ultimate Precision Machinist Tool for precision work. Enjoy a large, easy-to-read LCD screen, measuring range of 0-1 inch with a resolution of 0.00005 inch /0.001mm, making it suitable for a wide range of applications.

PRECISION & ACCURACY YOU NEED: Take precise and accurate measurements every time with the Sandor Tools Digital Micrometer's, hard carbide tip, easy calibration, and zero-set function. Includes a hard carrying case and is the perfect shop tool or to keep in your toolbox for or on-the-go work.

MEASURING RANGE: 0-1"/25mm; Accuracy: ±0.002mm, Resolution: 0.00005"/0.001 mm. Easily switch between Inch or MM with the simple press of a button. Expected battery life lasts 1 year. And with a rugged construction, it's built to last. The versatile and durable digital micrometer that offers unparalleled accuracy and quality - get yours now and experience the difference.

MULTIPLE APPLICATIONS: This Digital Micrometer is Perfect for DIY, Hobbyists, CNC Machinists, Fabricators, Automotive Mechanics, and Inspection Tools. Sandor Tools Outside Micrometers help you measure the outside dimensions (OD) of raw materials, whole workpieces, features in production, and more in wide application of metalworking and other industrial precision needs.

TRUSTED BRAND. WE STAND BY OUR PRODUCTS: When others talk quality, we deliver it. That's why we always offer a 100% Satisfaction Guarantee. At SANDOR Tool we only use the highest quality materials in our products suitable for hobbyist work to professional jobs, and we go the extra mile to stand by our tools. Your satisfaction is our priority. It's that simple!

name: Mitutoyo 193-211 Digit Outside Micrometer, 0-1" Range, 0.0001" Graduation, ±0.0001" Accuracy, Inch Vernier Scale with Digit Counter, Friction Thimble, Carbide Measuring Faces
short_description: PRECISION SMALL-RANGE MEASUREMENT: This micrometer measures 0?1" with 0.0001" graduations, combining a vernier scale with a mechanical digit counter for dual-read functionality, giving users enhanced accuracy and ease of reading.

CONSISTENT PRESSURE CONTROL: Equipped with a friction thimble, the micrometer applies uniform measuring force, ensuring repeatable results while minimizing operator error, even in critical quality control applications.

WEAR-RESISTANT MEASURING FACES: Flat, carbide-tipped measuring faces deliver excellent durability and maintain long-term accuracy, resisting wear while ensuring reliable performance across frequent measuring operations.

DURABLE, EASY-TO-READ FINISH: Satin chrome finish on the thimble and sleeve reduces glare and resists corrosion, while finely etched graduations ensure clear visibility and consistent results for professional shop use.

A LEGACY OF QUALITY: Our ultra-precise measurement solutions bring improved performance to countless industries, including aerospace, medical, automotive and energy. With more than 5,500 products?the largest product portfolio of any commercial metrology provider?we have the solutions you need to meet today's metrological challenges and customer expectations.
product_description: The Mitutoyo 193-211 digit micrometer is for taking outside diameter measurements. The micrometer has a measurement range of 0 to 1.0", graduations of 0.0001", and an accuracy of + or - 0.0001". This model has a vernier scale with a mechanical digit counter in inches for taking precise measurements. This micrometer has a friction thimble to help provide uniform pressure for precise, repeatable measurements. The measuring faces are flat and are carbide-tipped for durability. This micrometer has a satin chrome finish on the thimble for corrosion-resistance and visibility, and a hammertone baked-enamel finish with thermal shields on the frame for durability and heat resistance. This unit comes with a fitted, plastic case. Specifications Display typeVernier scale with mechanical digit counter in inchesAnvil/spindle styleFlat measuring faces, carbide tippedRange0 to 1.0"Graduation0.0001"Accuracy+ or - 0.0001"Flatness0.000024"Thimble styleFriction thimbleDimensions127.5mm length and 26mm throat depthWeight224g Micrometers are precision measuring instruments that use a calibrated screw to measure distances. These measurements are translated into large rotations of the screw that are then able to be read from a scale or a dial. Micrometers are typically used in manufacturing, machining, and mechanical engineering. There are three types of micrometer: outside, inside, and depth. Outside micrometers may also be called micrometer calipers, and are used to measure the length, width, or outside diameter of an object. Inside micrometers are typically used to measure interior diameter, as in a hole. Depth micrometers measure the height, or depth, of any shape that has a step, groove, or slot. Mitutoyo manufactures precision measuring tools, metrology equipment, and related systems. The company, founded in Tokyo in 1934, formed Mitutoyo America Corporation in 1963 with headquarters in Aurora, IL. What's in the Box? Mitutoyo 193-211 outside micrometer Plastic case

product_description: Fowler 54-870-001-0 Xtra-Value II Electronic Micrometer with 0-1"/0-25mm measuring range has a flat anvil/spindle pair for general purpose measuring. A switchable resolution of 0.00005"/0.001mm and an accuracy of 0.00016"/0.004mm provide precise readings and accurate measurements. The carbide measuring faces provide long life and wear resistance, and a ratchet thimble applies consistent force for repeatability between users. A jet black and gray enamel finish provides durability and wear resistance. The micrometer can be set to take absolute or incremental measurements. This product has a 1-year warranty offered by Fowler High Precision. Fowler, an American company, manufactures premium inspection and measurement instruments like electronic indicators, calipers, bore gages, and micrometers. The company, founded in 1946, is headquartered in Canton, MA.

product_description: The Mitutoyo 103 series outside micrometer has a vernier scale in inch units for taking precise outside diameter (OD) measurements, and a ratchet-stop mechanism for uniform pressure during adjustment. The micrometer’s frame has a baked enamel finish for protection and durability. The vernier scale on the thimble and sleeve is graduated to 0.001”, with a satin chrome rust- and glare-resistant finish. The spindle and anvil have flat measuring faces and are carbide-tipped for wear resistance. A spindle lock helps provide secure locking of the measurement position. Micrometers are precision measuring instruments that use a calibrated screw to measure small distances. These measurements are translated into large rotations of the screw that are then able to be read from a scale or a dial. Micrometers are typically used in manufacturing, machining, and mechanical engineering. There are three types of micrometer: outside, inside, and depth. Outside micrometers may also be called micrometer calipers, and are used to measure the length, width, or outside diameter of an object. Inside micrometers are typically used to measure interior diameter, as in a hole. Depth micrometers measure the height, or depth, of any shape that has a step, groove, or slot. Mitutoyo manufactures precision measuring tools, metrology equipment, and systems. The company was founded in Tokyo in 1934 and formed Mitutoyo America Corporation in 1963, which is headquartered in Aurora, IL.
